name: Benson Hotel

reviews.title: Old Skool Hotel that wasn't too shabby
reviews.text: Excellent stay here for 24 hours in May. Just a standard room but service, decor and hotel bar was all above par. An excellent business hotel in the heart of Portland. They did everything they could to make your stay a breeze. The room was on par with other Historical 4 star hotels I have stayed with large rooms, comfortable beds and all the mode flat screen cons. I would recommend this hotel!
We had room 1229 facing Broadway and east. Booked on line, the room was fine, the bathroom spacious and the windows could be opened,
reviews.title: A touch of class

reviews.text: Had breakfast and the service was excellent, the afternoon snack in the elegant foyer was okay too except for the unhappy server,
reviews.title: Great deal on Priceline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was helpful. The hotel is located 3 blocks from Pioneer square and we walked over from the train station ( we came by train from Seattle). On sunday, the downtown restaurants are, most of them, closed. The ''saturday outdoor market'' is open on sunday until 5'oclock. Free WiFi in room
reviews.title: Great location, but could use some bathroom renovations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a bid of $98 on Priceline, we were updated to a bigger room w/ King size bed on the corner room on the 9th floor (penthouse is 4 floors up). Checked in at 12:30pm and they accommodated us early. Staff was friendly. Bed comfortable. Superb location in the Pearl District for walking to cool restaurants (cheat eats and pricey ones) and cool shops (from typical high end shops to unique local ones). Beautiful lobby. Antique charm, hotel build 1912. Only drawbacks were the noise from the streets - bars/restaurants & cars since our room faced the main street, and lack of amenities (pool). If you're sensitive to noise, request a room in the back. Parking is expensive ($29). We parked on street (free Saturday evening until 1pm on Sundays) and in parking lots for less money.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in Downtown Portland

reviews.text: This is an older classic hotel. The reservation greeter was very pleasant. Valet service for parking is $29 a day plus tips. The beds were temper pedic, which my family did not care for, but for two full size beds in one room, they had no other options. The elevators were quick and easy. The hotel location is a couple small blocks to Powell Book Store and about a mile walk to the river. Many restaurant options in the neighborhood. We won this hotel thru priceline and were happy with the selection. We did not eat at the restaurant, but were given a $10 gift certicate upon arrival if we wished to try it. I would stay here again, however, be aware it's downtown and bums and beggars are within the area, so would not travel around after dark. We left area in the evenings in our car and when out walking were back in the room by 9:30. Rooms were clean and kept nicely.
reviews.title: Nice Downtown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the hotel lobby, we were met with an intense musky, moldy odor. That was a foreshadowing of what was to come. We were assigned a non-smoking room on the 5th floor with king-size bed and a view. First impression was that the room reeked of smoke, it was dark, and felt dingy and grimy. Took a look in the bathroom and it felt small and unclean. There's no ventilation in the bathroom either. We pulled off the bed cover and noticed that the underside had large, reddish brown stains. Gross. The bed was ok but overall, we couldn't get past the smell in the room and had to find a different hotel for our 3rd night in Portland.
reviews.title: They gave us a non-smoking room that reeked of smoke.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not quite sure with the bad reviews that I have seen, but my stay was sure great! When we arrived our room was not ready, but that is ok we arrived pretty early in the morning. The desk agent took our number, we stored our bags, and went exploring in Portland. We got a phone call about noon saying our room was ready so we returned to the hotel. When checking in we were told we had a room with a queen bed, we bid on priceline. I asked if there was a view from that room and informed there was not. I asked if we could have a room with a view and the agent informed us that all of the queens did not have a view. She quickly offered us a king with a view, I asked if it was going to be any extra for us to upgrade, and was told there was no extra charge. Our room was very nice it was on the 11th floor overlooking Broadway. All the staff was very friendly and welcoming to the hotel. We also enjoyed the happy hour they have in their lounge.
reviews.title: Already looking forward to our return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice for all of us who use priceline...if you want to request a certin type of room just ask.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location

reviews.text: The one downfall I have to say is that the TV's look like they are from the 80's.
reviews.title: Benson Hotel Evaluation

reviews.text: The Benson is a hotel that is a bit old-fashioned, but in the real, not in the "made-to-look-old" way. We stayed here for a conference, and were very happy.
reviews.title: Old-fashioned, perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff was courteous and efficient, the fresh apples and coffee free for taking were very appreciated, and in the evening, the bar was a nice place to unwind.
reviews.title: Even better the second time around!

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Benson and the staff was just as friendly as our last visit. We were very plesantly surprised to find that the bell attendant (Cort) recognized us from our visit last July. Cort, the concierge and the valet staff were incredibly helpful in giving us directions-by car and on foot-to various places around Portland. We indulged in their Sunday brunch and were definitely not disappointed. The price is very reasonable-about what we would have paid for one of us at Salty's restaurant in Seattle for their Sunday brunch. The London Grill's brunch at the Benson featured a huge array of foods; seafood, chicken, vegetable dishes, salads, made to order omlets, a carved meat station, and a gorgeous desert section. The London Grill's dining room is very elegant and because it's on the lower level of the hotel, it has a sweeping staircase that makes you feel like you are making a grand entrance. I was happy to discover that there are restrooms on the restaurant level, since last time I didn't know this and walked back into the main lobby. There is also an elevator on the restaurant floor for those who don't want to use the stairs. The Sunday brunch is well worth the indulgence and it made for a wonderful way to end our stay. We love the fact that the Benson is a Coast Hotel, since we have a Coast Rewards card. I highly recomend getting one, even if you only stay at this hotel once. The benefits are great. We had express check in and even though I got a great room rate online ($119), the hotel must have given us a larger room. It was much more spacious than the room we had last year. Will continue to frequent this hotel. It has a great location. Yes, the parking is expensive, but when you are treated like this, who cares? A few negatives... Housekeeping neglected to refill our toilet paper in the bathroom. Fortunately I found the extra roll in the closet and just changed it myself. Given that we have yet to have bad service here, I think it was just an oversight. Another negative would be the noise from outside the hotel. It continued until well past 2am. Unfortunately, the hotel really can't do much about noise coming from a few streets over through the window.
reviews.title: We kicked off our PacNW trip in Portland...

reviews.text: We kicked off our PacNW trip in Portland and stayed at the Benson for 3 nights. We got a pretty good value through tripadvisor and were overall happy with the acommodations. The hotel interior does have the appearance of a historic hotel with a grand lobby and smallish rooms. Yes, the TVs are not flat screen, the bathrooms & furniture a little outdated...but our room was very clean, the bed very comfy, & the staff friendly & accomodating. The location was perfect, you're within walking distance of Washington Park, Old Town, Pearl district, Pioneer Square. We even walked to the Portland Art Museum (~15 minutes). We loved Portland.
reviews.title: Way past its prime- time to renovate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Good, central location. Close to Chinatown, Pearl District and easy walk to all downtown destinations and public transportation. Room service was quick though expensive.
reviews.title: Do not stay here! Would have given this zero stars if possible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice older hotel. There is enough age to give it character and charm but enough updates to keep it clean and kept up. The wood in the lobby is beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. We got an excellent rate via priceline.
reviews.title: Aged to perfection

reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Priceline and it is 4 star quality with a great price. The rooms we great, clean with all the extras you expect at the higher priced hotels. This is a great location to everything downtown Portland. You won't need a car if you don't leave the city because you will have lot's of choices. We did have a car and parking in the city is high at $29 but you can also reduce that at other parking ramps, weekend was $11. Staff was helpful. My biggest complaint is that the lobby coffee is gone by 8AM! Lots of Starbucks if you get up late. It may not be the best 4 star but my family was more that satisfied and I would stay here again. Portland people are the nicest people we have met and we are nice here in Wisconsin.
reviews.title: Don't believe the bad reviews

reviews.text: This stately hotel was charming, well-kept, friendly and run by very competent staff. The entrance and lobby is stunning, harkening back to a glamourous 1940s. The rooms were up-to-date with the best hotel beds we've ever slept in. We booked through priceline, requesting a 4 star hotel, and thus did not know the name of our hotel until we had paid. We were very happy with all features of this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Charming and Welcoming

reviews.text: Right in the middle of downtown, walking distance to many restaurants and Powell's Books. Staff very accommodating, room was great. Would definitely stay there again. Small gripe - valet parking VERY expensive ($20)!!
reviews.title: Great location in Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Benson for 4 years now. I originally chose it for its boutique styling and central location. Though that has not changed, the attention to room maintenance and cleanliness has. Our particular room on this visit had water damage, peeling wall paper and well worn tables. Based on the economy, I do not think the hotel will engage in major repairs for several years, but they are needed now to maintain the grandeur that the hotel deserves. It is fairly priced, 25% less than competing boutique hotels in the area.
reviews.title: If only the rooms maintained the same theme and detailed upkeep as the lobby

description: Classic Landmark Hotel located in heart of business & financial district.
